description.narrative:
The programme "Sustainable Tourism" will be cofunded by Sida and USAID, a cooperation, recommended by a Sipu Mapping Study on Outlining possible areas and issues for Sida support to Economic Development in Albania, commissioned by Sida in order to explore possibilities to work on Economic development, as proposed in the Swedish Result Strategy for Reform Cooperation in Eastern Europe, Western Balkan and Turkey 2014-2020, and a workshop in Pristina, Kosovo. The cooperation is also following the fruitful cooperation between Sida and USAID in Bosnia.
The cooperation will be based on a USAID modality called Annual Program Statement (APS) co-funding scheme. The solicitation process will be on an annual rolling basis. It will be a demand-driven programme. The APS for the solicitation process will require candidates, profit and non-profit organisations to submit concept notes, the best of which will be asked to submit full project-proposals.
There will be awarded 5-10 projects for a period of 5 years, 2015-2020, 2-5 projects per year, depending on the quality of project proposals.
The intervention total budget will be about 52 MSEK, of which Sweden will provide 26 MSEK, while USAID will provide an equivalent amount of 3 million USD. Private sector is encouraged to fund the investment in equal sharing with USAID and Sida, either in kind or cash, which would potentially add up to the total intervention budget, with another 3 MUSD. (Thus, the potential total budget of the intervention amounts to approximately 9 MUSD, 78 MSEK).
Illustrative activities undertaken by projects could include (but not necessarily be limited to): • Improving soft infrastructure and planning for sustainable tourism, through pilot local economic development activities with local governments, tourism sector and civil society. • Strengthening the capacity of industry associations and educational institutions to provide targeted vocational training and job placement. • Strengthening the capacity of industry associations and educational institutions to improve feedback mechanisms and facilitation between labor market and education. • Enabling national-level industry advocacy to improve business enabling environment for sustainable tourism and through it the business ecosystem in general. • Strengthening “Agrotourism” in rural environments in Albania, to better connect the agriculture and tourism sectors, promote job growth in rural environments, and facilitate connections between high-quality local production and touristic services in rural environments. • Targeted training/mentoring to increase acceptance and utilization of international standards and certifications by industry to improve the confidence in and competitiveness of selected Albanian industry groups.

The programme is a cooperation between USAID and Sida, and the cooperation partner will be USAID. Being a demand driven programme, not having yet announced the Annual Programme Statement, which would identify the projects, there are not yet individual outcomes, at this stage. The theory of change is "Private-sector led tourism and workforce development can be “leading edges” in economic growth, stimulating national level impact in the business enabling environment, and local level impact in economic and social development." The objective of the whole programme is to increase economic opportunities for Albanian Citizens. The purpose of the programme is to contribute to improvements in tourism sector, including improvements to Albania's business enabling environment and workforce capacitites. By strengthening critical elements of Albanian tourism sector, this program will contribute to economic growth and Albania's European integration path.

title.narrative: Signed agreement and gift memo with USAID

description.narrative: The programme ''Sustainable Tourism'' in cooperation with USAID has entered his final year. 5 projects have been awarded and are under implementation. As stipulated in the agreement the projects are under USAID procedures. The Embassy of Sweden in Tirana goes in field visits, informative meetings and make decisions on amendments in cooperation with USAID. Annual meetings are organized for more detailed information. Financial information is given to the Embassy by USAID on the spent/unspent money for each contribution. Due to the new Administration of US, USAID has entered in a transitional period which led to stop the funding for new possible projects under the programme. A repayment has been done to Sida in January 2018 at the amount of 1 778 000 SEK. An evaluation is foreseen to be done during 2018. From the evaluation further results for the programme will be identified. Results for the set up in cooperation with USAID and for the selection of projects. When the evaluation will be completed a new conclusion on performance will be prepared.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
